Sorry. My bad. I've missed additional matchers library for JUnit.

Given th=
e currently available features of Java, I guess less verbose tests are impo=
ssible. I just hope when (and if) Java 7 comes out, and if language level s=
upport for collections feature is included, less verbose and more attractiv=
e syntax could be used for this:

assertThat( store.items, hasItems (
   al=
lOf( hasProperty ("name", "Bread"), hasProperty ("price", 15) ),
   allOf( =
hasProperty ("name", "Apple"), hasProperty ("price", 5),
   ...
));

Maybe =
something like:

assertThat( store.items, hasItems (
   hasProperties( {"na=
me": "Bread", "price": 15} ),
   ...
));

Michael

--- In junit@yahoogroups=
.com, Steve Freeman <smgfreeman@...> wrote:
>
> There are property matchers=
 in Hamcrest. Is that what you wanted?
> 
> S.
